group_1.textLeft: If you're looking for a professional chef,@I have just the girl in mind…

group_1.narration: "Go to Walnut's, a Western-style restaurant@with a long history, and see Manaka Kurumi."

group_1.textRight: Walnut's, huh…?

group_1.narration: …Considering how she was introduced,@I was bracing myself for meeting@somebody in a squirrel suit.
After Iroha and Yachiyo showed me the way,@I visited Walnut's and was greeted by…
Manaka Kurumi,@the daughter of the restaurant owner…@And a completely normal girl.

group_1.textRight: So you want to learn about cooking…@But what specifically are you after?

group_1.textLeft: I'm thinking about the meals we serve our team@at the coffee shop where I work.

group_1.textRight: Oh…so staff meals, then?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, things that are easy, quick to make,@delicious, and fun…
I'm unable to make anything that fits@these criteria.

group_1.textRight: I see… "Fun" isn't something I normally hear.
You're right, though. Staff meals need to be quick@to make, use on-hand ingredients, and taste good.
Here are the basics…
Sorry, the restaurant is busy today…

group_1.textLeft: Let me help you, then.@Just tell me what I need to do.

group_1.textRight: Really?! That'd be great!@Oh, do you need the ropes on serving food?

group_1.textLeft: I work in a cafe, so I should be able to handle@that to some degree.

group_1.textCenter: One plate of Walnut's special fluffy omurice,@coming right up.

group_1.textRight: Wow…this looks SO good!

group_1.textCenter: Yes, I'll be right with you.
(Knowing that Mitama, with her atrocious cooking@skills, was the one who told her about this place…)
(I was kind of on edge about what sort of person@she'd be.)
(But she's actually very deft and doesn't seem@clumsy or careless at all…)
(This'll be a nice and quiet cooking class.)

group_1.textRight: Hey, thanks for all your hard work.@You really helped me out there!

group_1.textLeft: It was my pleasure.@You have a very popular restaurant.

group_1.textRight: *Chuckle* Well, our food is delicious.@Of course it would be popular.
Anyway, now that lunch is over,
why don't we begin our special training class?
The golden standard of a cafe's staff meal is@chicken fried rice.
Are you able to make it with what your@restaurant usually has?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, most likely.

group_1.textRight: Then let's get to it.

group_1.textLeft: First, we cut the vegetables into one@centimeter pieces…

group_1.textRight: Looking good. Make sure the heat is consistent@and everything's getting cooked evenly.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, Master. Then our next step is…@Adding a bit of seasoning.
How many grams would suffice?

group_1.textRight: I'd say…about a fifth of a gram.
But add a pinch at a time to get the right taste.

group_1.textLeft: …I managed to do it.@What do you think…?

group_1.textRight: Hm, hm…it's a little overly cooked here@and there.
But the key element isn't the appearance,@but the taste.
Hm…!
I like it!

group_1.textLeft: Thank goodness…

group_1.textRight: That said, it's a tad soggy and the flavor@is uneven.
There's room for improvement…
But if it's something your cooking for your loved@ones, I'd say it's a-okay!

group_1.textLeft: I'm glad you liked it.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, I think it's perfectly suitable.

group_1.textLeft: …This is certainly something quick and requires@just a few ingredients to make.
But…there's no "fun" in this dish.
While I enjoy chicken fried rice as part@of my meal,
I'd like to add another fun dish to expand@my repertoire.
Yes, things that are easy, quick to make,@delicious, and fun…
I'm unable to make anything that fits@these criteria.

group_1.textRight: Fun… I recall you mentioning that before.
Well, your cooking skills aren't so bad.
I'll try coming up with a fun menu, then!

group_1.textLeft: Thank you very much!

group_1.textRight: Hm… It's gotta have favorite food in it…
Takina, what's Chisato's favorite thing to eat?

group_1.textLeft: Chisato's favorite food…
